titleStmt.title: A. C. Sugg et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2543

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of Kentucky --

We the undersigned "Board of Councilmen" of Uniontown, Union County, Kentucky -- do hereby certify that W. F. Berry was duly Elected to act as "Police Judge" for Said town -- on Monday the 5th day of August 1861.= instead of Wm H. Wheeler who resigned on 18th July '61= and would therefore pray your Honor to grant a Commission to Said Berry Elect & forward as Soon as possible=given under our hands. this the 6th day of August 1861.

A. C. Sugg chairman
Green G. Boyle
E. S Clark
R. L. Byrne

attest
William Anderson
Clerk of "B of C"

Uniontown
Po. Judge
W. F. Berry
Comd Aug 30 1861
